intro: Vieusseuxia pavonia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
